messageBody:
Kevin Lawrence writes:

> The answer to that question is that junit was designed for
> TDD where it is important that all the tests be independent.

Fair enough, but Allen's question still stands (and it's a need I have
recognized fairly early on in my own testing as well): it is quite often
necessary to have code invoked:

- At the beginning and the end of the suite
- At the beginning and the end of a test class
- At the beginning and the end of a test method (covered by setUp() and
tearDown())

I suppose an argument can be made that when you have such requirements, you
are no longer doing unit testing and that you should be using TestNG :-)
(which covers all these cases)
